comments:
Build: I20050509-1200

I got this NPE several times when opening a manifest editor. I have not been
able to reproduce the error, and after closing and reopening the editor, there
do not appear to be any other side-effects. Full log attached.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.isDirty(FormEditor.java:262)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEFormEditor.computeDirtyState(PDEFormEditor.java:437)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEFormEditor.isDirty(PDEFormEditor.java:427)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEFormEditorContributor$SaveAction.update(PDEFormEditorContributor.java:105)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEFormEditorContributor.updateActions(PDEFormEditorContributor.java:297)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEFormEditor.editorDirtyStateChanged(PDEFormEditor.java:461)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEFormEditor.fireSaveNeeded(PDEFormEditor.java:453)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDESourcePage.firePropertyChange(PDESourcePage.java:224)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.AbstractTextEditor.initializeTitle(AbstractTextEditor.java:2923)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.AbstractTextEditor.doSetInput(AbstractTextEditor.java:3010)
	at org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.StatusTextEditor.doSetInput(StatusTextEditor.java:173)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.AbstractDecoratedTextEditor.doSetInput(AbstractDecoratedTextEditor.java:1263)
	at org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextEditor.doSetInput(TextEditor.java:262)

This is interesting. The field in question is initialized right in the 
declaration, so it is troubling that it can be null at any point. I added the 
check for null in 'isDirty' but I am still puzzled.
The dispose() method makes the field null...
